comments.body:
I don't think that this works by default.  I _think_ that this is used as the address to get to the proxy.  But when running in a container, 127.0.0.1 will go to the localhost in the container and not the proxy.

@thockin is this still relevant in the new IP-per-service world?
I don't get it - these are flags for apiserver, right?  apiserver is not in a container (yet) is it?

When we populate the service env variable for a container (in [GetServiceEnvironmentVariables](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/blob/343677580a5af96e700c8b191245a23a8b178387/pkg/registry/service/rest.go#L195)) we _were_ using the IP address/name of the minion as far as the api server knew it.  If the "name" of the minion that the apiserver sees is `127.0.0.1` then we would use that value to try and point the code int he container at the proxy.  But it couldn't get to the proxy as the `127.0.0.1` _inside_ the container would mask the `127.0.0.1` of the host.  I suspect now that we have IP-per-Service this issue no longer applies.
Ah, yes.  In that case it won't matter.  SERVICE_HOST is dead.
